Plintissa looked at Gangon and Lightmare with those worried eyes. Lightmare=
 stood up. She was pleased to find she could still stand, but the pain was =
forcing her down. Plintissa handed her a cane. She tried to hold it in her =
left hand, but was unable. Lightmare held the cane in her right hand. Plint=
issa took Lightmare into the next room.

"Lightmare, I'm sorry, but your le=
ft arm, is dead, and we don't have any way to fix it." Plintissa said, look=
ing sadly into Lightmare's eyes. Lightmare stared at Plintissa, knowing tha=
t she was telling the truth. Lightmare sat in a chair, and Artist kindly, w=
ith a sneer on his face, brought her a glass of water. Lightmare set down t=
he cane took the water, just staring, thinking about what she was going to =
do now.

"Gangon got the worst of it." Dracona said. Plintissa sighed and w=
alked into the room again.

"Gangon, I hate to break bad news but..." Plint=
issa said.

"I know, I can't move." Gangon said, looking into the future a =
little more deeply than Lightmare.

"Yes, sorry." Plintissa said, a sad loo=
k in her eyes.

"I just thought that there would be some importance in my l=
ife. BrightBlade left me, and I knew after that, that my life was over." Ga=
ngon said sadly.

"You still have some life left." Plintissa said.

"How wo=
uld you like to not be able to move?" Gangon said. He tried to lift his arm=
, but it wouldn't move. He tried to lift his other, it would only move half=
way.

"I suck!" Gangon yelled. Artist brung Gangon a glass with a straw in =
it.

"I hope you know how to use a straw, boy!" Artist said angrily. Artist=
 stormed out of the room angily. Plintissa sighed. Gangon accidentally knoc=
ked the glass down, breaking it.

"That's okay, I'll get you another one." =
Plintissa said. Gangon tried to get a piece of glass to kill himself with, =
but he couldn't move. He sighed and layed there, hopeless and scared, and l=
onely, and in his mind, WORTHLESS!!!...
